# Why? (continued)

While we were prompted by the example of the smart meters, the challenges and
solutions presented are essentially applicable to any temporal data collected more than once a year

- traffic sensors
- pedestrian movement data in metro stations
- public buildings, cab or bike rides
- Temperature or precipitation collected over time.

---

What?

- describes classes of time deconstructions using linear and cyclic time
granularities. 

- provides tools to compute possible cyclic granularities from an ordered (usually
temporal) index

- a framework to systematically explore the distribution of a univariate
variable conditional on two cyclic time granularities

---

How? Breaking down the method briefly

- Why we are considering probability distributions
- harmony and clashes
- narrow search using significant harmonies
